intro: Obione axillaris, commonly known as the axillary obione, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is occasionally cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance.
